p: A Pearson’s correlation analysis was executed between different studied parameters of two rye varieties ( Figure 5). In both Krona and Valdai varieties, contents of MDA, H 2O 2, proline, dehydroascorbic acid, 2,3-diketogulonic acid, and phenolic compounds, as well as activity of SOD positively correlated with the oil concentration in soil (r > 0.5, p < 0.05). The negative correlation was detected between contents of MDA and H 2O 2 and growth-related parameters, contents of chlorophyll a, total chlorophylls, carotenoids. Additionally, in the Krona variety, contents of non-protein thiols, ascorbic acid and activities of CAT and GPX were negatively correlated with parameters of oxidative stress (r = −0.51 to −0.95, p < 0.05).
